user.biography: Life with Senior Dog Rescues, Bikini the pig,  Betty the chicken and Tofu the turkey.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Steve Greig on August 29, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and outdoors.

node.text:
It's been a hard week.  Edsel got a blood clot and wasn't expected to live.  Then Edith's cancer treatment took quite a toll.  But yesterday was better than the day before.  And today is better than yesterday.  They are both getting a little stronger and I am so grateful. ❤
#givethanks

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Steve Greig on August 25, 2021. May be an image of dog.

node.text:
Loretta is next in the profile series. 

She is 16 years old and has been with me since she was 4. I adopted her long before I started only adopting senior dogs or dogs with disabilities. We both owe her adoption to a dachshund that happened to be out on a walk the day I went to the shelter. I had gone there to adopt that dachshund after noticing him online. But when I arrived a volunteer had taken him out for a walk.  So I wandered around and I happened to see Loretta huddled up in the corner of her cage.  I squatted down by the door and after some coaxing she slowly walked up and gave me one lick and then returned to the far corner. That's all it took I was smitten. The shelter said she was living on the streets for a long time before they were able to catch her. Since then, her shyness had kept her from getting adopted. 

Loretta is the rock of Wolfgang2242. She always eats,  never complains, and other than teeth cleaning she has never been to the vet that I can think of.  Her only quirk is she is terrified of things falling on her from above. I don't know what happened to her in the past,  but if you make any loud noises when she's right below you she runs for cover. She squints when she smiles. She's closest with Edsel although she also seems to have a little crush on Fernando (keeping her options open). But her one true love is cheese.  She can be on an entirely different floor of the house and if someone discreetly starts to open a cheese wrapper in the fridge, it activates some kind of personal Bluetooth system and she'll be at your side with wanton eyes before the cheese ever leaves the package. 

Likes:  The volunteer walk program at the shelter 

Dislikes:  The story of Chicken Little 

Goals:  Head cheese Sommelier in Paris 

Nickname LoRo, Butcher hollaback girl (a nod to Loretta Lynn who's from Butcher Holler)

node.text:
We were horsing around on the beach, challenging each other to foot races, and Carter good naturedly agreed to race Kitty. Carter didn't really try, but Kitty gave it everything she had. 

I don't want to get overly dramatic about how hard this little dog tries in life, and how no one would adopt her because she is incontinent. But man...., just look at her go!
#gokittygo

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Steve Greig on August 11, 2021. May be an image of Maltese and outdoors.

node.text:
A good vacation changes you; the way you breathe, the way you think, the way you dress and the way you see yourself. 
Kitty at the cape. 
#chchchchanges

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Steve Greig on August 08, 2021. May be an image of outdoors.

node.text:
There's a certain, undeniable point in your vacation, after the groceries are purchased, the bikes are rented and everything is unpacked, when your body exhales into bliss.
Kitty at The Cape.
#catatonic

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Steve Greig on August 04, 2021. May be an image of dog and indoor.

node.text:
I promise to pick up the profile series again in a few days, when I'm sitting by the ocean in a beach chair with a Mojito in the attached cup holder and a foofy little dog named Kitty in my lap. So, prepare for a somewhat looser, mojito influenced, style of writing ahead. 

In the meantime, between a couple of house sitters, a neighbor and my housekeeper, I believe the home front is covered. Some of the animals are staying at home with the house sitters, but these dogs in the picture are headed to my housekeeper's place, or Camp Chihuahua as she likes to call it. 

Don't worry Camp Chihuahua has a non-discriminatory policy and accepts all dogs whether they be, look like, know, or ever have known, an actual Chihuahua or not. It's really #campchihuawhatever . (I hear the arts and crafts classes are stellar and I'm sure I'll have a refrigerator door covered in macaroni-ed construction paper when they return.)

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Steve Greig on July 31, 2021. May be an image of Maltese and indoor.

node.text:
I'm using Raylenes legs as a holding area while I clean up a glass I dropped and broke. 
#irishborder

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Steve Greig on July 27, 2021. May be an image of dog and text that says 'MELVIN'.

node.text:
Melvin is next in the profile series.  I adopted him from @truefaithfulpetrescuemission when he was 14 and he is currently 18 years old.
He can't really see anymore but he still hears ( no surprise there) and overall he does very well for a dog his age.  After he wakes up from his naps, with a little trial and error he can still find the doggy door and let himself outside.  Although to be honest, if I see him wandering around, I'll just grab him and put him outside to prevent a "well, I tried" scenario.  Everybody in the house loves Melvin, although Fernando is definitely President of the fan club and Hertha is Vice President.  Hertha is a little clueless (about life in general) and for some reason anytime she sees Melvin wandering around trying to get his bearings, she's just positive he must be looking to wrestle.  Melvin wants nothing to do with that, or with her, so he soon sounds his "get off my lawn" old man bark and I'll run down and pluck him out of the wrestling ring. 
When I adopted Melvin @truefaithfulpetrescue asked one of their volunteers to fly him out to Denver.  @thedodo heard about the adoption and asked to film our initial meeting live for their account.  I agreed but I was pretty nervous about meeting him in the airport for the first time in front of cameras.  I had no idea how he would react to coming out of his dog carrier in front of a stranger after a long trip.  Would he mistake me for the flight attendant and blame me for the turbulence, the airplane food, the economy seat assignment?  Would his first reaction be to bite said flight attendant before squatting and peeing on the floor as the icing on the cake of his flight review?  All these thoughts were running through my head but Melvin ended up being a true professional.  Although unaware of the possibly millions of @thedodo fans watching live, he took a couple steps out of the dog carrier, smiled for the cameras, wagged his tail, and walked over and sat in my lap.  We both agreed to have each other's back from that moment forward.
Likes:  The idea of a little alone time
Dislikes:  Popup wrestling matches
Goals:  Dish Network sponsorship
Nickname: Melvin Mouseketeer

node.text:
One of the reasons giving medicines to all these dogs takes so long. 😁  #sweetvictory
(I know everyone has a "secret" of the best food to hide a pill in but for Melvin it isn't about the food.  He loves pill pockets but he's almost 19 so it takes a min to warm up to the idea, then I have to work with his eye to mouth coordination, which is a little off, to help him get it in.  I have other dogs that it really does depend on what you are putting the pill in.  But not Melvin.)

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Steve Greig on July 23, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and dog.

node.text:
Edsel is next in the profile series. This is the first picture I ever took of him only hours after being adopted and it's still my favorite. 

In a nutshell, he's 14,  he's inquisitive, he's expressive, he's hilarious and he's a fighter. Edsel was in heart failure almost 3 years ago with about a year and a 1/2 life expectancy. He's on a lot of heart meds and naturalpathy supplements and he is doing incredible. He still likes to show off when I get home from work by running around at top speed until his legs give out or some coughing sets in, but by then he's proved his point and both of us beam with pride. I've traveled all over with Edsel. He's been to New York City several times for petcon, and LA for vidcon,  Cape Cod for Vacationcon, I mean vacation, and lots of other cities when we were promoting the children's book. He's good with kids, he's good with dogs, and he's good with being the center of attention. 

If someone in the house is working on something they'll soon feel Edsel's breath on their hands while he gets his head close enough to the project to see exactly what's going on. He does the same thing if you're playing a board game or opening a package or working on your taxes. I swear he's taking notes on how to open up his own planet. Move over Pluto. 

When I tell him it's time for medicine he gets this expression that says, "Who me?  Surely you have the wrong dog!" But once he realizes I'm not buying it, he's actually a champ about taking them.  Following a routine is in my nature so he's never missed a day and together we've kept his heart disease at bay. Caring for someone that needs it, is an honor. Remember that. 

Likes: beating the odds 

Dislikes:  the phrase, "None of your business". 

Goals:  100 meter dash, summer Olympics 2024

Nickname:  Edsel Mertz.  And Edsel P Williams, which is too long to explain in full, but it's a nod to a previous dog that he was adopted in honor of named Phyllis.❤

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Steve Greig on July 19, 2021. May be an image of dog.

node.text:
Next up in the profile series in order of size (as long as you include the circumference of her head) is Kitty. Kitty was an "accident". (Ironically she also happens to have some "accidents" but we'll get to that part in a minute.) The inn at Wolfgang2242 was full up with dogs when she appeared at my door as part of the senior dog promotions I do for the Maxfund Animal Adoption Center. Out of the 5 years or so that I've been doing these promotions, Kitty is the only one that didn't end up with any applications. I'm sure it's because she is incontinent. That's probably due to a spinal injury, but for whatever the reason, she can't always control her on/off valve. When I found out she was still at Maxfund several weeks after the promotion, I asked if I could take her home for the holidays, and then of course it was all over. I officially adopted her shortly after that.

When you pick up Kitty, kiss her, and tell her how cute she is, she gets so tickled by the attention that she pees in delight. I mean, you kinda gotta take that as a compliment.  If we are outside and she's not wearing a diaper, I've learned to bend at the waist and hold her out far enough to prevent shoe splatters. If we're in public it looks a little ridiculous, but you know, you do what you gotta do. 

 Kitty's personality is demanding, aloof and goofy. Whereas the other dogs are good with some alone time,  Kitty wants to be with me every minute. I take her with me as much as I can, but when I can't she becomes momentarily aloof. "Well I didn't really want to be with you anyway." When she's in an extra good mood, usually right before bed,  she becomes a little white speed ball, racing around the yard and up the stairs, prancing around at the top of the landing like a pent up show pony. Even though I'm always second place in this race, the laughter is worth the  loss. 

Likes: maximum absorbency 

Dislikes:  when cats answer to her name 

Goals:  never ever lose the race to bed.

Nickname:  Kitty Kitty Bang Bang
